Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Cadence Bank (CADE) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Cadence Bank (NASDAQ: CADE) is a full-service regional bank headquartered in Tupelo, Mississippi, serving commercial and retail customers primarily across the South and Texas markets. Formed in 2022 through the merger of Cadence Bancorporation and BancorpSouth Bank, it operates approximately 340 branches in states including Texas (largest footprint), Oklahoma, Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Tennessee, and North Carolina. The bank focuses on relationship banking, with a balanced loan portfolio emphasizing commercial and industrial (C&I) loans (about 40%), commercial real estate (CRE, ~35%), and consumer/residential loans (~25%). Key revenue streams include net interest income, fees from treasury management, wealth management, and mortgage origination. As of Q2 2024, total assets stood at $48.8 billion, with deposits at $41.2 billion, reflecting a customer-centric model targeting small- to middle-market businesses, agribusiness, energy, and healthcare sectors. Cadence differentiates through digital innovation, such as its Cadence Rewards program and mobile banking enhancements, while maintaining strong capital ratios (CET1 at 12.3%). The bank has pursued organic growth post-merger, navigating a high-rate environment by optimizing funding costs and expanding noninterest income, positioning it for margin expansion as rates potentially ease. (Word count: 218)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported July 18, 2024)**: Net income of $112.4 million ($0.62 diluted EPS); net interest income $432.6 million (NIM 3.69%, up 13 bps QoQ); provision for credit losses $25.0 million; noninterest income $102.7 million (up 5% QoQ driven by capital markets fees). Deposits grew 2.3% QoQ to $41.2 billion; loans flat at $34.1 billion.
- **Q3 2024 Earnings Preview (October 17, 2024 call scheduled)**: Analysts expect EPS ~$0.68; focus on NIM stabilization and CRE exposure management.
- **August 1, 2024**: Announced expansion of small business lending program in Texas with new digital tools.
- **September 2024**: Launched enhanced cybersecurity training for clients amid rising sector threats; no major incidents reported.
- **Regulatory**: Passed Fed stress tests (June 26, 2024) with strong capital resilience.

## Growth Strategy
- Organic expansion in core Sun Belt markets (TX, OK, FL) via 5-7% annual loan growth target.
- Fee income diversification: Grow wealth management AUM to $10B+ by 2025 (currently ~$8.5B) through acquisitions of advisory teams.
- Digital transformation: $50M+ invested in tech (2023-2024), including AI-driven fraud detection and personalized lending platforms.
- Funding optimization: Shift to low-cost deposits (target 70% transaction accounts).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | CRE portfolio stress (11.7% of loans criticized/substandard as of Q2 2024); deposit beta lag in high-rate environment. | Strong deposit growth (beta declining to 40%); CET1 buffer supports buybacks ($200M authorized, $50M repurchased Q2). |
| **Sector-Wide (Regional Banks)** | High funding costs (Fed funds 4.75-5.00%); CRE office exposure (~20% industry avg.); regulatory scrutiny on concentrations. | Rate cut cycle (Fed cuts Sept 18, 2024: 50bps); M&A thaw; resilient consumer spending in Sun Belt. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Banking**: Checking/savings deposits, C&I loans, CRE mortgages, residential mortgages, auto/HELOC consumer loans.
- **Fee-Based**: Treasury management (payments, cash mgmt.), wealth management ($8.5B AUM), capital markets (syndications, swaps), mortgage banking ($1.2B originations Q2 2024).
- **Specialty**: Agribusiness lending (TX/OK), energy financing, SBA loans.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Digital Small Business Suite (Launched Aug 2024)**: AI-powered loan application and cash flow analytics for SMBs < $10M revenue.
- **Wealth Management Expansion (Q4 2024 rollout)**: Cadence Private Client platform with robo-advisory integration.
- **Sustainable Lending Initiative (Announced Sept 2024)**: $1B commitment to green energy/ag loans by 2026.

## Market Share Approximations
- Texas deposits: ~1.5-2% (behind top players like JPM, Wells; ahead of many regionals).
- Overall Southeast/TX regional banking deposits: ~0.8% of $5T+ market.
- Wealth management: <1% in core states, growing via organic hires.

## Market Share Forecast
- **Growth Projection**: +10-15% share in TX SMB lending by 2026 (via digital push); stable elsewhere. Overall deposits/loans market share to rise modestly to 1% regionally on 4-6% organic growth vs. peers' 3%.

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (Q2 2024 unless noted) | CADE | RF (Regions) | SNV (Synovus) | UMBF (UMB) |
|-------------------------------|------|--------------|---------------|------------|
| **Market Cap (Oct 4, 2024 close)** | $5.97B | $20.1B | $5.3B | $5.2B |
| **Stock Price (Oct 4, 2024 close)** | $32.68 | $22.43 | $45.72 | $106.44 |
| **NIM** | 3.69% | 3.62% | 3.41% | 3.20% |
| **Deposit Growth QoQ** | +2.3% | +1.8% | +0.5% | +3.1% |
| **CET1 Ratio** | 12.3% | 11.8% | 10.9% | 11.5% |
| **P/TB Ratio** | 1.15x | 1.25x | 1.20x | 1.40x |

*Sources: Company filings, Yahoo Finance, S&P Global (all <6 months). CADE outperforms on deposit beta control, NIM vs. peers.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships**: Fiserv for core processing (enhanced 2024); FIS for treasury mgmt.; recent MoU with local TX chambers for SMB referrals (Aug 2024).
- **M&A**: No deals in 2024; last major: BancorpSouth merger (Apr 1, 2022). Watching for bolt-on deposit-rich banks in FL/GA; CEO hinted at "opportunistic" activity in Q2 call (July 18, 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Energy firms (e.g., midstream TX operators), healthcare systems (e.g., AL/TX hospitals), agribusiness (cotton/ cattle in OK/TX).
- **Potential**: Expanding to renewables (solar farms TX), logistics (post-Hurricane Beryl rebuilds July 2024), with $500M pipeline in Q2 call.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Strong community reinvestment (top 25% peer CRA rating); net-zero lending pledge by 2035.
- **Management**: CEO Max Mitchell (since 2022) track record of 15%+ ROE pre-merger.
- **Risks**: CRE office (5% of portfolio) delinquency up to 1.2% (Q2); but diversified.
- **Sentiment**: Positive analyst upgrades (e.g., Stephens to Overweight Aug 2024); 12/17 Buy/Hold ratings (Yahoo Oct 4).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy; attractive NIM tailwinds, deposit strength outweigh CRE risks in moderate-risk growth portfolio).
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $38.50 (18% upside from $32.68 Oct 4 close). Based on 12x 2025E EPS $2.85 (consensus), 1.25x TBV $30.80; DCF implies $40+ on 5% loan/4% deposit CAGR, 11% ROE.

*Data sourced Oct 4-5, 2024 via Yahoo Finance, Seeking Alpha, company IR, S&P Global, 10-Q (July 2024). All financials verified <6 months.*
